summary: This is the Fifth Amendment to Jeffrey E. Epstein's 2001 Trust One, executed in October 2007. The key provision forgives any debts owed to Epstein at the time of his death by a list of 16 named individuals, including Jean-Luc Brunel and Mark Lawrence Epstein. The document is signed by Epstein and notarized by Lauren J. Kwintner.

connections.description: Epstein forgives any debt Brunel owes him upon Epstein's death, indicating a creditor-debtor relationship.
Epstein forgives any debt Mark Lawrence Epstein owes him upon Epstein's death, indicating a creditor-debtor relationship, likely familial.
Epstein forgives any debt Indyke owes him upon Epstein's death, indicating a creditor-debtor relationship.
Kwintner acted as the notary public for Epstein's execution of the trust amendment.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein amended his trust in October 2007 to forgive all debts owed to him at the time of his death by 16 named individuals.
The list of debtors includes Jean-Luc Brunel, a French modeling agent and close associate of Epstein who was later charged with sex trafficking.
The list also includes Mark Lawrence Epstein, indicating a financial relationship with a family member.
Other notable debtors include Darren Indyke (Epstein's longtime lawyer) and Steven Victor.
The document shows Epstein was actively managing his estate and financial relationships through a trust structure years before his arrest and death.
